questions.text: Dory had a friend she talked with through the pipes when she was a young fish. As an older fish, Dory met her "pipe friend". What was her name?
questions.explanation:
Destiny.

	Dory's story began one year after "Finding Nemo". As a young fish, Dory used to speak to a friend through the pipes in the Open Ocean exhibit. This is how she learned to speak whale. When she went to the Marine Life Center, she met Destiny, who identified herself as Dory's "pipe friend". Destiny was voiced by Kaitlin Olsen.

questions.correct: Sea Lion outside the Marine Life Center
options: A beluga whale who hurt his head
Bird that helped Dory and the others
questions.explanation:
Sea Lion outside the Marine Life Center.

	Gerald was a sea lion that lived outside the Marine Life Center. He was always seen trying to get onto a rock that two other sea lions were sunning themselves on.

questions.text: Hank, the octopus, helped Dory find her family so he could use her tag to get out of the Marine Life Center. What was unique about Hank?
options: Hank thought he was an eel
questions.explanation:
Hank had seven tentacles.

	Hank was an orange octopus voiced by Ed O'Neill. Hank wanted to use Dory's tag so he could leave the center and go to Cleveland. Dory promised her tag to him if he helped her. Hank told Dory he had seven tentacles because of a kid and that's why he didn't like people touching him.

questions.text: Where was the truck going that left the Marine Life Center with Marlin and Nemo inside?
questions.explanation:
Cleveland.

	Nemo and Marlin were trapped inside the truck that was taking animals to Cleveland. They were trapped in the blue tang tank and Dory had to rescue them with the help of her friends from the Marine Life Center. She was able to get them and the other fish along with the truck into the ocean.

questions.text: Dory's parents taught her a song when she was a little girl. What is the missing lyric(s): "We see the undertow and we say ______"?
options: I'm Dory and I have short term remembory loss!
questions.explanation:
Heck no!.

	Dory's parents were trying to teach her how dangerous the undertow was and that she should never get close to it. Dory accidentally got too close to the undertow and it sucked her into the ocean and this is how she became lost.

questions.text: What actress provided the voice that played through the speakers at the Marine Life Center?
questions.explanation:
Sigourney Weaver.

	Dory heard Sigourney Weaver's voice through the speakers when she first found the Marine Life Center. Several times Dory referred to Sigourney Weaver as her friend. After losing Marlin and Nemo, Dory found the Marine Life Center again by hearing Sigourney Weaver's voice.

questions.text: What did Dory's parents lay in a pattern so Dory could always find her way home?
questions.explanation:
Seashells.

	Dory's parents laid out shells in different directions that all led back to her house so she could follow them and find her way home. When Dory left the exhibit and went back to the ocean, she followed the shells and found the home her parents had made in hopes she would find them again.

questions.text: What state did Dory remember she lived in as a child?
questions.explanation:
California.

	Dory remembered that she lived in California. Marlin used Crush to help them get to California to help Dory find her family. When Dory was a child she and her parents lived in the Open Ocean exhibit at Marine Life Institute in Morro Bay, California.

questions.text: How did Dory get to the Open Ocean exhibit where her parents were?
questions.correct: She and Hank used a child's stroller
options: Her friend, Destiny, tossed her into the exhibit
She flew in a bucket carried by a bird
She swam from the ocean into the exhibit
questions.explanation:
She and Hank used a child's stroller.

	Hank used a child's stroller with Dory in a sippy cup to take him and Dory to the Open Ocean Exhibit. After Dory got them out of the touch tank at the kids zone, Hank was able to get Dory into the Open Ocean exhibit. Unfortunately, her parents moved after she disappeared.

questions.text: The aquarium crew from "Finding Nemo" was seen outside the Marine Life Center at the end of "Finding Dory". Had they escaped their plastic water bags?
questions.explanation:
No.

	The aquarium crew from "Finding Nemo" made it to California after a year of floating from Australia. As they were enjoying their freedom, the boat from Marine Life Center picked them up and took them to quarantine. As the boat took off, Bloat (voiced by Brad Garrett) was heard repeating his line from "Finding Nemo", "Now what?"
